name: TI MIXTIE -- I have built a few mixtie frames since I started building but this is my first ti version.  This one will be built up with a carbon fork and disc brakes -- definatley a sweet town commuter.

data.message: Is this being built for you Tim?
not this one, but there is a full-suspension in the works Kathy :)
That will be the sweetest town commuter EVER!  Some cat has some MONEY!!!!  ;0)
Supermamachari™
This is just wrong on so many levels, but wrong in an awesome sort of way.

name: NAHBS SHOW BIKE SNEAK PEEK -- The boys at Spectrum just sent me this photo of one of my NAHBS show bikes they are working on.  This dirt road bike is getting a bit of an early 70's Porsche inspired paint job.  Stay tuned for complete bike photos.

data.message: I like it!! I wish i could afford to get my bike repainted.
That is soooooo cool!
how are you building it up?
Looks like an old Merckx paint scheme.
Super stylish!
It looks horrible... I bet you can't sell it.  I'll tell ya what... I'll be a peach and give ya $100 and pay for the shipping ;)
I dig classic styling, super rad!
Paint is nice but it covers up those awesome welds...
that paint reminds me Peugeot bikes from the 80s.. nice job anyways..

Hey everyone thanks so much for the comments!  My 7 year old son had a good one -- "dad it looks like a piece of candy corn".  For the show this frame is going to be built up with a Force or Uletraga group and red Ritchey stem, bar and post.  The fork is a wound up for long reach brakes as it is the only one with the room for a 32c tire.  By the way I did forget to mention this bike is for sale -- if any of you can use a 565 top tube and are looking for a dirt road bike contact me directly for special pricing.
let's get a shot of this!

i actually imagined that I was riding this bike today on my ride....I have a sickness.  Just so Paul Paul H. Sadoff isn't upset, I will say I was not riding my  Rock Lobster while day dreaming about the pictured DeSalvo.
It's o.k. .....there's always some great stuff coming out of the DeSalvo shop.

name: NEW TUNES FOR MY SHOP -- Look closely and  some of you may recognize the Landshark logo on my new shop speakers.  Yep these sweet sounding speakers were built by my good friend and fellow bike builder John Slwata of Landshark bicycles.  When John is not making carbon bikes he finds time to build some really nice speakers.

data.message: ribbon tweeter. This would make a killer surround cabinet
does he build guitar amps?

name: FULL RACK OF BIKES -- Here is the result of a couple days of hard welding.  When I get to the Vanilla workshop to help with a run of Speedvagens they have all of the tubes mitered and fit up so I can weld till my eyes fall out.  Scott, Greg, and I put in a couple hard days to get 32 bikes welded up.  After I leave they still have to braze in the seat stays and the small parts (and do the finish work) and then the frames can go to the paint shop.

data.message: That is really cool. I have work bench envy
a dream office..
Nice speakers too... rock and roll!
are some getting carbon top and seat tubes?
Wade when I took the photo some of the top tube were not in yet -- top tubes are all steel but some were getting carbon seat tubes.
by the way, Rock it out Mike!
I can't wait until I start seeing spy shots of my new rides! But I guess that involves me sending over my order forms, huh? Very soon, this week. :)

name: LOTS O SEATTUBES -- Many of you know that a couple times a year I make the trek up to Portland to hang out with the boys in the Vanilla Workshop and weld like crazy.  This is how it all begins -- they send me the seat tubes and BB shells to weld in my own shop.  I will head north with these and early next week we will have over 30 bikes welded in need of seat stays.  Stay tuned...

data.message: Sounds like fun!
Knowing that you welded my 2011 SV made it even better!  "Made in Oregon!"
Thanks Ray!
Stop by on your way up ro back down!

name: This sharp single speed road bike is on it's way to Texas -- thanks Lydell.

data.message: Very nice job, Mike!
yowzers!!  beautiful bike!
Like? Wheres the LOVE IT button?
Thanks guys!
Very cool!
what's the gearing?
Ken - it is a 48 /16.
my next rig... (i want a 50x16)  it is FLAT HERE in Houston...
Orange is goood

name: Gary sent me this cool photo of him with his lugged bike I built for him.

data.message: Gary, nice picture...you are now famous!

name: This steel cross frame made it back from the painters just in time to make it under the Christmas tree.  Sorry Cedric if it smells like framesaver when you open the box.

data.message: dang, that is good looking
Thanks Chris.
that is an amazing color (and a neat frame as well).
Framesaver smells like roses with that bike
such an awesome bike, love the color!
Standard head tube or oversized? It's hard to tell...
... and I never asked, can you do replaceable derailleur hangars on steel bikes like this?
Mike builds beautiful bikes!

name: I built this full suspension frame for Tim Tidball -- he is the one responsible for all of the super nice photos on my website.  For the upcomming year I will be offering this steel version and hopefully a ti version around NAHBS time.

data.message: very cool!!!
Vern: is it a 29er?
Jana, this one is for 26" wheels but I can do them 29ers also.
That's sweet! Ventana rear? How much travel?
Yes Ventana rear end. 4-5" travel.
coming soon .... complete bike studio pics!

name: This ti road frame is a good example of how crazy you can get with custom paint.  There is even a carbon fork painted pink to match this frame.  This one is on its way to Japan.

data.message: That is freaking HOT!!!
Who did the paint?
Pink is the new blue.  Just saying.
Mark are you coming out of the closet?
Thanks Maria!  Paint on this one was done by Spectrum -- the customer came up with the design.
Spectrum rocks... great stuff.
Perfect color for my girl Suzanne Marcoe!
Nice looking frame! I even like the pink.
fricken sweet
可愛いo(^▽^)o
Oh, my baby turned out to be a girl... Thanks Mike!
beautiful.

name: Rich's new ti 29er single speed looks pretty sharp with the red Chris King goodies!

data.message: a beauty!
kool
that it does indeed...
Very nice!
Hey Mike. Those are the CS's I'm looking for! Where did you get those??? Thanks.
what is the BB shell width on this Beautiful SS 29er?
Love the drop outs!

name: My new shop is getting a blasting room!

data.message: sweet!  We are swinging by for your recycling!!!!

name: Torsten just sent me this cool photo of his 10 year bike in Times Square.

data.message: nice piece, surprised it has not been ripped off
I suppose Torsten only stood back enough to take the photo and probably did not turn his back.  Otherwise he probably would not have made it home with his bike.

name: After almost a full week of moving stuff it is nice to be setting up my new work space!

data.message: Looks great Mike!
Thanks Brad!
Um sweet time to make a trials bike for me.   I mean I'm just sayin.
Really nice shop cragrats Mike. AARON
schwanky, is that vapor seal or are you going to raise the curtian and surprise us all with a new concept;)

name: Framebuilding shop to go.  With some help from team member Cory L. and his family and the use of the Sappo Hill fork lift we got all of my machines loaded and to the new location today.  Now the real fun begins!

data.message: Whoa! Guess I can hold off on my new frame until you get all those machines moved and plugged in.
Excellent!
